title: Go won't compile: const c = cmplx(2, 2); const x = real(c); const y = imag(c)
body:
What steps will reproduce the problem?
Run this tiny program:

package main
func main() {
  const c = cmplx(2, 2)
  const x = real(c)
  const y = imag(c)
}

What is the expected output?
Nothing.

What do you see instead?
test.go:4: const initializer must be constant
test.go:5: const initializer must be constant

Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?
6g


Which operating system are you using?
debian testing 64-bit

Which revision are you using?  (hg identify)
51c777dbccb9+ release/release.2010-12-22

Please provide any additional information below.
I queried the behavior on go-nuts & "peterGo" said it looks like a bug, so
that's why I've reported it.
